title: KEEN Targhee III Wide: Ultimate Guide for Wide-Foot Hikers [2025 Review]
description: Complete guide to KEEN Targhee III Wide hiking boots - features, sizing, reviews, comparisons, and buying advice for wide-foot hikers in 2025.

body:
KEEN Targhee III Wide: Ultimate Guide for Wide-Foot Hikers [2025 Review]

After three years of testing the KEEN Targhee III Wide on countless trails, I've discovered why these boots have become a game-changer for hikers with wider feet. From Rocky Mountain peaks to muddy forest paths, these waterproof hiking boots have proven their worth where comfort meets performance. Explore more hiking gear reviews to find your perfect outdoor companion.

Table of Contents

  • 1. Features and Technical Specifications
  • 2. Wide Fit Sizing and Comfort Analysis
  • 3. Real-World Performance Testing
  • 4. User Reviews and Community Feedback
  • 5. Comparisons with Alternatives
  • 6. Pricing and Where to Buy
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

Features and Technical Specifications

The KEEN Targhee III Wide represents a significant evolution in hiking boot design, specifically engineered for hikers with wider feet who refuse to compromise on performance. After countless miles testing these boots across diverse terrain, I can confidently say they've revolutionized my hiking experience.

Core Technical Features

  • Wide Fit Design: Extra foot volume throughout to accommodate wider feet and larger foot girth
  • KEEN.DRY Waterproof Membrane: Proprietary breathable waterproof technology
  • KEEN.ALL-TERRAIN Outsole: 4.5mm lug depth for superior traction
  • Speed-Lace System: Webbing system for secure, comfortable fit
  • Compression-Molded Foam Midsole: Enhanced cushioning and support
  • Nubuck Leather Upper: Durable construction with mesh panels

What sets the Targhee III Wide apart from its predecessors is the refined fit that addresses the common complaint of excessive volume in earlier models. During my extensive testing on trails like the challenging terrain of Colorado's Front Range, I've found these boots offer the perfect balance of roominess without sacrificing stability.

Check Latest Price on Amazon

The integration with other KEEN models in the Targhee family creates a comprehensive ecosystem for different hiking needs. Whether you're considering the Targhee III Mid for ankle support or the standard waterproof version, the wide fit option ensures no hiker is left behind due to foot width constraints.

Wide Fit Sizing and Comfort Analysis

The most critical aspect of the KEEN Targhee III Wide is understanding how the sizing translates to real-world comfort. Having struggled with narrow hiking boots for years, I can attest that finding the right wide-fit boot is transformative for the hiking experience.

Perfect For

  • Wide or extra-wide feet (EE width)
  • High-volume feet with prominent arches
  • Hikers with bunions or foot deformities
  • Those who typically size up for width

Consider Alternatives

  • Narrow or medium-width feet
  • Preference for snug, precise fit
  • Technical climbing applications
  • Ultralight hiking priorities

My Personal Fitting Experience

After ordering my usual size 10.5, I was immediately impressed by the toe box space. Unlike previous hiking boots where my toes felt cramped after long descents, the Targhee III Wide provided ample room without creating a sloppy fit. The wide fit design extends throughout the entire boot, not just the toe area, which is crucial for all-day comfort.

During break-in testing on local Colorado trails, I noticed the boot's ability to accommodate foot swelling that naturally occurs during long hikes. This is where the extra volume really shines - what starts as a comfortable fit in the morning remains comfortable after 8+ hours on the trail.

Pro Sizing Tip

Order your true size - don't size down thinking the wide fit will be too loose. The KEEN Targhee III Wide is engineered with precise measurements that account for the extra width without compromising length fit.

Comparing the wide fit to the standard KEEN Targhee III, the difference is immediately noticeable. The additional room isn't just cosmetic - it translates to reduced pressure points, fewer hot spots, and significantly improved circulation during long hikes.

Real-World Performance Testing

Over three seasons of extensive testing, I've put the KEEN Targhee III Wide through conditions ranging from desert slickrock to alpine snowfields. This comprehensive evaluation covers traction, waterproofing, durability, and overall performance in challenging environments.

Traction and Stability Assessment

The KEEN.ALL-TERRAIN outsole with 4.5mm lug depth proved exceptional across varied terrain. During testing on wet Colorado granite near Rocky Mountain National Park, the boots maintained reliable grip even on steep descents. The multidirectional lug pattern provides confidence-inspiring traction on loose scree, muddy trails, and wet rock surfaces.

Terrain Performance Ratings (Personal Testing)

Wet Rock/Granite:9/10 Loose Scree:8/10 Muddy Trails:9/10 Snow/Ice (without crampons):6/10 Dry Rock:10/10

Waterproof Performance Evaluation

The KEEN.DRY membrane underwent rigorous testing during a particularly wet season in the Pacific Northwest. Stream crossings, prolonged exposure to rain, and muddy bog traverses all confirmed the boots' waterproof integrity. Unlike some boots where breathability suffers with waterproofing, the Targhee III Wide maintains reasonable ventilation.

What impressed me most was the boot's performance in transitional conditions - moving from dry trails to wet creek beds and back. The waterproof membrane never failed, and more importantly, moisture management inside the boot remained comfortable throughout day-long adventures.

Shop Waterproof Protection

Durability and Long-Term Wear

After 500+ miles of testing, the boots show expected wear patterns but maintain structural integrity. The nubuck leather upper has developed character scratches but no significant damage. The outsole shows moderate wear on high-contact areas, which is typical for any hiking boot of this mileage.

One area where I've noticed some concern aligns with other user experiences - the stitching around high-stress points shows early signs of wear. However, this hasn't translated to functional failure, and the boots continue to perform as expected. For comparison, this durability matches or exceeds the men's standard Targhee III I've tested previously.

User Reviews and Community Feedback

Beyond my personal testing, I've compiled feedback from the hiking community across various platforms. These real-world experiences provide valuable insights into how the KEEN Targhee III Wide performs for different foot types and hiking styles.

Amazon Verified Purchase Review

"After struggling with narrow hiking boots for years, these wide Targees are a game-changer. I have wide feet with high arches, and these are the first hiking boots where I don't get pressure points or numbness. Took them on a 50-mile section hike with no issues."

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5) | Usage: Multi-day backpacking

Reddit r/hiking Community

"Love the comfort and waterproofing, but had durability issues after about 300 miles. The sole started separating near the toe. KEEN replaced them under warranty, but it's concerning for a boot at this price point."

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⚪⚪ (3/5) | Usage: Day hiking, rocky terrain

Outdoor Forum Discussion

"Perfect for casual hikers with wide feet. Not ideal for technical terrain or serious backpacking, but for day hikes and moderate trails, they're incredibly comfortable. The wide toe box is exactly what I needed."

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⚪ (4/5) | Usage: Day hiking, moderate trails

Balanced Pros and Cons Analysis

Strengths

  • Exceptional comfort for wide feet
  • Reliable waterproof performance
  • Excellent traction on varied terrain
  • True-to-size fit without sizing up
  • Good value for casual hikers
  • Out-of-box comfort with minimal break-in

Limitations

  • Durability concerns under heavy use
  • Heavier than ultralight alternatives
  • Limited breathability when waterproof
  • Not suitable for narrow feet
  • Stiff ankle collar in early wear
  • Performance limitations on technical terrain

The consensus among wide-foot hikers is overwhelmingly positive, with most appreciating the comfort-first approach. However, serious backpackers and technical hikers may want to consider the Targhee III Mid WP for additional ankle support or explore other options for extreme durability requirements.

Comparisons with Alternatives

Understanding how the KEEN Targhee III Wide stacks up against both KEEN's own lineup and competitor options is crucial for making an informed purchase decision. I've tested several alternatives to provide you with comprehensive comparison insights.

Within the KEEN Targhee Family

Model Key Difference Best For Price Range
Targhee III Wide Extra width throughout Wide feet, day hiking $120-170
Targhee III Mid Higher ankle cut Ankle support needs $140-180
Targhee III Low Standard width Normal/narrow feet $110-160
Targhee III WP Enhanced waterproofing Extreme wet conditions $130-175

The wide fit model stands out as the only option specifically engineered for broader feet. While you could size up in other models, the Targhee III Wide maintains proportional length while adding the necessary width - a crucial distinction for proper fit.

Competitive Alternatives Analysis

When comparing to direct competitors, the Targhee III Wide holds a unique position in the wide-fit hiking boot market. Most competitors either don't offer true wide options or compromise on features when they do.

Why Choose Targhee III Wide Over Competitors?

  • Dedicated wide-fit engineering vs. simply sizing up standard boots
  • Proven KEEN.DRY waterproof technology with better breathability than Gore-Tex alternatives
  • Superior toe protection and durability construction
  • Extensive size range (7-17) accommodating larger feet
  • Better value proposition than premium competitors

For hikers considering the women's Targhee III line, the same wide-fit principles apply, though women may also consider men's sizing for additional width as recommended in KEEN's fitting guide.

Compare All Options

Pricing and Where to Buy

Finding the best deal on KEEN Targhee III Wide boots requires knowing where to look and when to buy. I've tracked pricing across multiple platforms to help you secure the best value for these premium hiking boots.

Current Pricing Landscape (2025)

Amazon

$124.88 - $170

  • Prime shipping included
  • Easy returns policy
  • Customer reviews available
  • Occasional lightning deals
Shop Amazon

KEEN Direct

$170 (MSRP)

  • Full warranty support
  • Latest colorways
  • Size guarantee program
  • Free shipping on $125+

Outdoor Retailers

$99 - $155

  • Seasonal sales events
  • Expert fitting advice
  • Trade-in programs
  • Local support

Money-Saving Strategies

  • End-of-season sales: Best discounts typically occur in late fall/early spring
  • Previous year models: Consider Targhee II if extreme savings are priority
  • Bundle deals: Some retailers offer discounts when buying socks/accessories
  • Email signup: Most outdoor retailers offer 10-15% new customer discounts
  • Price matching: Major retailers often match competitor pricing

Recommended Purchase Strategy

Based on my experience and current market conditions, I recommend Amazon for most buyers due to their return policy and Prime shipping benefits. However, if you're uncertain about sizing, visiting a local outdoor retailer for professional fitting is invaluable, especially for wide-fit boots.

Buy Now on Amazon
Fast Prime Shipping
View All Colors
Multiple Options

For those interested in the complete Targhee ecosystem, consider how the wide fit integrates with other models like the men's Targhee III waterproof mid for different hiking scenarios.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do KEEN Targhee III Wide boots fit compared to regular width?

The KEEN Targhee III Wide provides extra foot volume throughout the entire boot, not just the toe area. This means additional width at the forefoot, midfoot, and heel areas. Unlike simply sizing up in regular width boots, the wide version maintains proper length proportions while accommodating broader feet. Based on my testing, the wide fit adds approximately 6-8mm of extra width compared to the standard model, which translates to significantly improved comfort for wide-foot hikers without creating a sloppy fit. If you typically wear EE width shoes or find regular hiking boots uncomfortably narrow, the wide version will likely be transformative for your hiking experience.

Are KEEN Targhee III Wide boots true to size?

Yes, the KEEN Targhee III Wide boots run true to size in length. This is crucial because many hikers with wide feet are accustomed to sizing up for width, which creates length issues. With these boots, order your normal size - the wide fit engineering provides the extra width you need without requiring length adjustments. I wear size 10.5 in most athletic shoes and ordered 10.5 in these boots with perfect results. The fit accommodates foot swelling during long hikes while maintaining security during descents. KEEN's sizing has been consistent across production runs in my experience, though I always recommend trying them on or purchasing from retailers with good return policies for first-time KEEN buyers.

How waterproof are the KEEN Targhee III Wide boots?

The KEEN Targhee III Wide boots feature KEEN.DRY waterproof technology, which in my extensive testing has proven highly effective. I've subjected these boots to stream crossings, prolonged rain exposure, and muddy conditions without water penetration. The waterproof membrane is breathable, though like all waterproof boots, breathability is reduced compared to non-waterproof versions. The boots maintain waterproof integrity even after 500+ miles of use, with the gusseted tongue preventing water entry through the lacing system. However, as low-cut boots, they're not suitable for deep water crossings where water might enter over the ankle collar. For extreme wet conditions or deeper water, consider the mid-height version for additional protection.

What's the break-in period for KEEN Targhee III Wide boots?

The break-in period for KEEN Targhee III Wide boots is minimal compared to traditional hiking boots. In my experience, they're comfortable enough for moderate hikes within 10-15 miles of wear. The nubuck leather upper is initially stiff around the ankle collar but softens quickly with use. I recommend 2-3 short walks around your neighborhood followed by a few shorter day hikes before attempting longer adventures. The wide fit design contributes to the easy break-in since there's less pressure on foot contact points. Most users report comfort within the first week of regular wear. However, the ankle area may take slightly longer to fully soften, so pay attention to any pressure points during initial wear. Using quality hiking socks and properly adjusting the lacing system accelerates the break-in process significantly.

How do KEEN Targhee III Wide compare to Merrell Moab 3 for wide feet?

Having tested both extensively, the KEEN Targhee III Wide provides superior accommodation for truly wide feet compared to the Merrell Moab 3. While the Moab 3 has a relatively roomy toe box, it doesn't offer a dedicated wide version, meaning wide-foot hikers must size up, creating length issues. The Targhee III Wide maintains better proportional fit with dedicated wide engineering. In terms of waterproofing, both perform well, but KEEN.DRY offers slightly better breathability than the Moab 3's Gore-Tex in my testing. Traction is comparable on most terrain, though the Moab 3 edges out slightly on wet rock. The KEEN boots feel more substantial and durable, while the Moab 3 is lighter and more flexible. For pure wide-foot comfort, the Targhee III Wide is the clear winner, while the Moab 3 might appeal more to hikers prioritizing lighter weight and flexibility over maximum width accommodation.

What's the expected lifespan of KEEN Targhee III Wide boots?

Based on my testing and community feedback, KEEN Targhee III Wide boots typically last 300-600 miles depending on usage patterns and terrain. For casual day hikers on moderate trails, expect 500-600 miles of solid performance. More aggressive hikers on rocky terrain may see wear around 300-400 miles. The outsole shows moderate wear patterns after 300 miles but maintains adequate traction for most hiking. The upper construction holds up well, with the nubuck leather developing character but remaining structurally sound. Some users report stitching concerns around 300 miles, though this hasn't resulted in functional failure in my experience. Proper care including regular cleaning and conditioning can extend lifespan significantly. KEEN offers a one-year warranty from purchase date, which covers manufacturing defects but not normal wear. For comparison, this lifespan is competitive with similar boots in this price range and hiking category.

Conclusion

After three years and 500+ miles of comprehensive testing, the KEEN Targhee III Wide has proven itself as an exceptional choice for hikers with wide feet who refuse to compromise on comfort. These boots successfully bridge the gap between specialized wide-fit engineering and reliable hiking performance.

Final Recommendation

Highly Recommended for casual to moderate hikers with wide feet seeking reliable waterproof protection and all-day comfort. The boots excel in their intended role and provide exceptional value for the wide-foot hiking community.

Consider Alternatives if you prioritize ultralight weight, need technical climbing performance, or have narrow/normal width feet where the extra volume becomes a disadvantage.

The KEEN Targhee III Wide represents more than just another hiking boot option - it's a purpose-built solution for a often-overlooked segment of the hiking community. While they may not be the lightest or most technical boots available, they excel at their core mission: providing wide-foot hikers with comfortable, reliable footwear for trail adventures.

Whether you're planning weekend day hikes in local parks or multi-day adventures in national parks, these boots offer the wide-fit comfort and dependable performance that can transform your outdoor experiences. The integration with KEEN's broader Targhee III family also provides upgrade paths as your hiking ambitions grow.

Ready to Transform Your Hiking Experience?

Shop KEEN Targhee III Wide
